revised_title: Rectification of the Hyperbola and Advantages of Descending Series
tldr: The author, John Hellins, presents a new theorem for rectifying the hyperbola and discusses the advantages of using descending series over ascending series in calculations. He also critiques a previous method by John Landen, which uses two ellipses, as being circuitous and requiring more calculation than necessary. This paper is an appendix to Hellins' earlier work on the same subject.
